page.title: 09Transport in the Lee Valley
page.content: The only east/ west route in this area is the{Lea Valley road.}It provides the only link between {Enfield and {Chingford.}There are two major north/south routes which are{Mollcoon {Avenue}which is a major route joining all the industries on the Lea Valley industrial estate and{Sewardstone Road which is a major route from Chingford to Waltham Abbey and travels along the west side of the reservoirs.The railway runs from north to south on the eastern side of the industrial estate,the stations being Ponders End and Enfield Lock.Trains go north to Bishop's Stortford and south to Liverpool Street,London.There are also London Transport Bus Routes which end at Brimsdown garage and the 107 route through Enfield to Barnet.
